http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif EDSIG List EDSIG List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=EDSIG&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=EDSIG.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-10T00:21:02Z Rebecca Park 2015-03-10T00:20:58+00:00 2015-03-10T00:20:58+00:00 Re: Dual diagnoses, bipolar, anorexia, BUPA cover and medication https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;87e7666f.1503 Dear Helena<br>these are tricky patients to manage and all the harder I would imagine if in the private sector.<br>In my experience Lamotrigine can be quite helpful for bipolar depression comorbid with ED, but it takes a while to build the dose up slowly ( see BNF guidelines). Also it has neutral effects on weight and bingeing , in contrast to most atypicals including quetiapine which at higher doses especially tends to increase binges in binge purge patients.<br>( leading to a balancing act between controlling the mania and controlling the binges.)<br>Good luck and best wishes<br>Rebecca [...] Helena Fox 2015-03-09T13:53:22+01:00 2015-03-09T13:53:22+01:00 Dual diagnoses, bipolar, anorexia, BUPA cover and medication https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;7fab6351.1503 I am wondering if anyone has treated bipolar disorder at the same time as an eating disorder? Im sure people have and it would be good to hear of experience.<br>I have a patient who has restrictive anorexia (BMI 17) with severe binge-purge cycle who has now developed hypomanic episodes along with more longstanding<br>depression.<br>Problem 1 is: She is in private care and BUPA have said they will no longer fund her for the eating disorder but will only fund for the assessment and treatment of her bipolar.<br>Yet I fail to see how this could be possible as [...] Ayton Agnes (RNU) Oxford Health 2015-03-06T15:18:26+00:00 2015-03-06T15:18:26+00:00 Re: MARSIPAN checklist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;1b02b426.1503 Thank you - much appreciated! I worry about starting 5-10kcal/day though. In one of my patients it would only be 130-260kcal /Day<br><br>With best wishes,<br><br>Dr Agnes Ayton MD MMedSc FRCPsych MSc<br>Consultant Psychiatrist<br>Cotswold House Oxford<br>07585402210<br>01865902609<br>Please note that I am often unable to read emails during working hours due to clinical commitments. If you need emergency advice, please ring my mobile number or contact switchboard 01865741717 for Cotswold House Reception or the ward as the office is not always manned [...] Paul Robinson 2015-03-06T14:40:00+00:00 2015-03-06T14:40:00+00:00 MARSIPAN checklist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;719f2b47.1503 An eagle eyed colleague has spotted a typo in our checklist. It's going to<br>be corrected, but do feel free to look for it yourself!<br><br>http://www.rcpsych.ac.uk/pdf/CR189checklist.pdf<br><br>Best washes<br><br>Paul<br><br>Dr Paul Robinson MA MD FRCP FRCPsych<br>Research Consultant Psychiatrist<br>Barnet Enfield and Haringey Mental Health Trust<br>Research Dept<br>St Ann's Hospital, Block H<br>St Ann's Road<br>London N15 3TH<br>tel: 02084426503<br>Mob: 07752419035 Hart Cleo (NHS GRAMPIAN) 2015-03-05T10:51:32+00:00 2015-03-05T10:51:32+00:00 FW: new MARSIPAN checklist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;da4aed0e.1503 Dear Colleagues,<br>I'd be grateful if you could thank Dr Robinson for disseminating this very important checklist.<br>You'll see that I have sent this out widely within Grampian.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Cleo Hart<br><br>Dr Cleo Hart<br>Consultant Child and Adolescent Psychiatrist<br>The Rowan Centre<br>The Glassgreen Centre<br>Elgin<br>IV30 6GQ<br><br>Tel: direct line: 01343 553111<br>or int.ext 63111 Paul Robinson 2015-03-05T09:52:59+00:00 2015-03-05T09:52:59+00:00 new MARSIPAN checklist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;988fa617.1503 Dear All,<br><br>I and Dasha Nicholls have put together a checklist for the use of any clinician meeting a really sick patient with anorexia nervosa (any age). It is on the RCPsych website.<br><br>http://www.rcpsych.ac.uk/pdf/CR189checklist.pdf <http://www.rcpsych.ac.uk/pdf/CR189checklist.pdf><br>It is linked from the MARSIPAN report page here: http://www.rcpsych.ac.uk/usefulresources/publications/collegereports/cr/cr189.aspx <http://www.rcpsych.ac.uk/usefulresources/publications/collegereports/cr/cr189.aspx><br><br>Please send it to your local A and E, admitting doctors and ward managers in relevant wards. We hope it proves a helpful brief aid to prevent deaths in MARSIPAN patients. It can be printed as a postcard. [...] Morris Jane (NHS GRAMPIAN) 2015-02-18T16:48:09+00:00 2015-02-18T16:48:09+00:00 Re: MARSIPAN checklist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;760fb7fd.1502 This is extremely helpful Paul - thanks to you both. I think it may also lend itself to incorporation in intranet guidelines for localHealth Boards, possibly inluding specific names and contact details too. Will certainly make audit more straightforward<br>Regards<br>Jane<br>Dr E Jane B Morris<br>Consultant Psychiatrist, The Eden Unit<br>Royal Cornhill Hospital, Aberdeen<br>Lead Clinician, North of Scotland Managed Clinical Network for Eating Disorders<br>Honorary Senior Lecturer, University of Aberdeen<br>Honorary Fellow, Universities of Glasgow and Edinburgh<br>Associate, Newnham College, Cambridge [...] Matthew Cahill 2015-02-18T13:21:23+00:00 2015-02-18T13:21:23+00:00 Re: MARSIPAN checklist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;7bf80772.1502 Hi Paul<br><br>Looks good.<br><br>In our MARSIPAN guidelines / protocols we extend the high risk a little further to<br><br>Patient is at HIGH RISK of refeeding syndrome if:<br>1. Anorexia Nervosa BMI<16<br>2. Little or no nutrition for >10 days<br>3. Low levels of potassium prior to feeding<br>4. Low levels of phosphate prior to feeding<br>5. Low levels of magnesium prior to feeding<br>6. Chronic alcoholism<br>7. Chronic diuretic use<br>8. Uncontrolled Diabetes Mellitus [...] Dahabra, Sylvia 2015-02-18T13:19:03+00:00 2015-02-18T13:19:03+00:00 Re: MARSIPAN checklist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;a4fb4e30.1502 This is a useful aid. I will discuss with medical colleagues. Perhaps each area use this or develop somehting similar for the acute hospital intranet.<br><br>From a recent encounter on a medical ward, I suggest that you add the need to prescribe Thiamine or Pabrinex and Forceval or similar on admission ie as per Newcastle Guidelines in Appendix 2.. [...] Paul Robinson 2015-02-18T12:59:47+00:00 2015-02-18T12:59:47+00:00 MARSIPAN checklist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;6d661fbb.1502 Dear all,<br><br>I and Dasha Nicholls have developed the attached checklist. Please send it to physician colleagues and anyone else interested. We would be very interested in feedback on how it works in practice and any improvements you may wish to suggest.<br><br>Regards<br><br>Dr Paul Robinson<br>Research Consultant Psychiatrist BEHMHT and Hon Senior Lecturer UCL<br>Research Dept<br>St Ann's Hospital<br>St Ann's Road<br>London N15 3TH<br>tel: 02084426792<br>Mob: 07752419035 McQueen Daniel (CYGNET HEALTH CARE LIMITED) 2015-02-13T13:06:38+00:00 2015-02-13T13:06:38+00:00 Re: measuring complexity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;3d998360.1502 Hi Agnes<br>Inpatient.<br>best wishes<br>Dan<br><br>Daniel McQueen<br><br>Consultant Psychiatrist<br>Eating Disorder Unit<br>Cygnet Hospital Ealing<br>22 Corfton Road, Ealing, W5 2HT<br>Tel: 0208 991 6699<br>Fax: 0208 991 0440<br>http://www.cygnethealth.co.uk/locations/ealing/eating-disorder-unit.html<br><br>On 13 Feb 2015, at 11:27, Ayton Agnes (RNU) Oxford Health <Agnes.Ayton@OXFORDHEALTH.NHS.UK<mailto:Agnes.Ayton@OXFORDHEALTH.NHS.UK>> wrote:<br><br>I did a few years back. Do you work in inpatient or outpatient setting?<br><br>With best wishes<br><br>Dr Agnes Ayton<br>MD MMedSc FRCPsych MSc<br>Consultant Psychiatrist<br>Cotswold House Oxford<br>Warneford Hospital<br>Old Rd<x-apple-data-detectors://1><br>Oxford<x-apple-data-detectors://1><br>OX3 7JX<x-apple-data-detectors://1> [...] Ayton Agnes (RNU) Oxford Health 2015-02-13T11:27:00+00:00 2015-02-13T11:27:00+00:00 Re: measuring complexity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;4499db50.1502 I did a few years back. Do you work in inpatient or outpatient setting?<br><br>With best wishes<br><br>Dr Agnes Ayton<br>MD MMedSc FRCPsych MSc<br>Consultant Psychiatrist<br>Cotswold House Oxford<br>Warneford Hospital<br>Old Rd<x-apple-data-detectors://1><br>Oxford<x-apple-data-detectors://1><br>OX3 7JX<x-apple-data-detectors://1><br><br>07585402210<tel:07585402210><br>01865<tel:01865738835>902609<br><br>Please note that I am often unable to read my emails during working hours, so if your query is urgent, please either ring my mobile or the office at Cotswold House [...] Andrea Brown 2015-02-13T10:35:00+00:00 2015-02-13T10:35:00+00:00 Re: measuring complexity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;6e60eb7b.1502 Dear All,<br>Has anyone created an audit tool to measure compliance against the NICE guidance for CG9 Eating Disorders. For some reason NICE have not provided one unlike many other guidelines? I thought it was worth asking before we start creating one from scratch!<br>With best wishes,<br>Andrea Brown<br><br><font size="2" color="blue" face="arial"><br><br><p><i><font color="green">Mental health care: for people, not for profit</font></i></p> [...] McQueen Daniel (CYGNET HEALTH CARE LIMITED) 2015-02-10T19:17:32+00:00 2015-02-10T19:17:32+00:00 measuring complexity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;63ac01ab.1502 Does anyone have a dataset that they use for measuring complexity in ED patients? Or is there a validated/standardised data set in existence?<br>Thanks in advance.<br>Dan McQueen Rebecca Park 2015-02-05T09:54:31+00:00 2015-02-05T09:54:31+00:00 Fwd: Your article has been included: Behavioral Sciences Most Read:Mindfulness In Anorexia Nervosa https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;771898d0.1502 Dear all<br>below a free link to a paper of ours on Mindfulness in Anorexia Nervosa, feel free to download and circulate as you think fit<br>kinds regards<br>Rebecca<br><br>Dr Rebecca J Park MB BCH PhD<br>Clinical Senior Lecturer<br>Department of Psychiatry<br>University of Oxford<br>UK<br><br>www.psych.ox.ac.uk/team/PIs/rebecca-park<http://www.psych.ox.ac.uk/team/PIs/rebecca-park><br><br>www.psych.ox.ac.uk/research/brain-eating-disorders<br><br>Begin forwarded message:<br><br>From: "Phillips, Louise" <Louise.Phillips@tandf.co.uk<mailto:Louise.Phillips@tandf.co.uk>><br>To: "rebecca.park@psych.ox.ac.uk<mailto:rebecca.park@psych.ox.ac.uk>" <rebecca.park@psych.ox.ac.uk<mailto:rebecca.park@psych.ox.ac.uk>><br>Subject: Your article has been included: Behavioral Sciences Most Read<br>Date: 3 February 2015 12:04:14 GMT [...] Jonathan Baggott 2015-01-02T10:03:50+00:00 2015-01-02T10:03:50+00:00 ED consultant post https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;65b2d08e.1501 Dear All<br><br>For anyone who wishes to start off the new year with a new job then we have a wonderful job opportunity for a Consultant in Eating Disorder Psychiatry in Leicester. You would be joining a well-established team which in addition to the 8 session consultant post being advertised has two full time consultant psychiatrists, and associate specialist, ST4 and CT3. We provide comprehensive ED out-patient and day patient services to the population of Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland and specialist in-patient care for anorexia nervosa to the East Midlands circa 5 million pop. We are also active in teaching, [...] Ayton Agnes (RNU) Oxford Health 2014-12-07T23:37:55+00:00 2014-12-07T23:37:55+00:00 Re: risk assessment tool for patients with Eating Disorders https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;2be39b81.1412 Thank you Dasha for this, generally it works well for CAMHS population.<br>The issue for adults seems more complicated, as there is higher rate of comorbidity (alcohol, laxative abuse, etc) and the length of malnutrition can be much longer. I am trying to pull together the information from various national guidance for our community team so that the risks can be managed consistently, only to find that the various guidance (MUST, NICE, junior and adult MARSIPAN and IOP) are all varied and I can\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt find much evidence base. I would be interested in whether other services use a structured risk [...] Schmidt, Ulrike 2014-11-30T20:51:31+00:00 2014-11-30T20:51:31+00:00 MANTRA workshop https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;ccc264c6.1411 Dear colleagues,<br><br>This is just to let you know that we will be running a 2-day skills workshop on MANTRA (Maudsley Model of Anorexia Nervosa Treatment) in the new year. Please disseminate to anyone who you think might be interested.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Ulrike Schmidt Ayton Agnes (RNU) Oxford Health 2014-11-29T12:44:03+00:00 2014-11-29T12:44:03+00:00 Re: I'm sharing "Associations of maternal weight gain in pregnancy with offspring cognition in childhood and adolescence: findings from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children." https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;ed25b1d5.1411 Thank you Nadia, this is really helpful. There seems to be a differences of opinions re the best way forward between people with or without CAMHS training, so addressing this in the Nice guidelines would be important<br><br>With best wishes<br><br>Dr Agnes Ayton MD MMedSc FRCPsych MSc<br>Consultant Psychiatrist<br>Cotswold House Oxford<br>07585402210<br><br>On 29 Nov 2014, at 11:22, "Micali, Nadia" <n.micali@ucl.ac.uk<mailto:n.micali@ucl.ac.uk>> wrote: [...] Micali, Nadia 2014-11-29T11:19:16+00:00 2014-11-29T11:19:16+00:00 Re: I'm sharing "Associations of maternal weight gain in pregnancy with offspring cognition in childhood and adolescence: findings from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children." https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;c2a777ed.1411 Hi Agnes,<br>Sorry for joining in late, I was on holiday,<br>We have published many papers on the effects of maternal ED on various outcomes.<br>The attached is a meta-analyses on maternal AN and offspring birth-weight, which might be useful.<br>BMI is a strong mediator in relation to child birth-weight.<br>In the UK we don't have specific guidelines in relation to maternal weight gain in pregnancy, but I often use the US institute of medicine ones, which stipulate exactly how much weight per week/month a woman should gain depending on whether they were under- or over weight pre pregnancy. I [...] SGUL 2014-11-26T18:12:34+00:00 2014-11-26T18:12:34+00:00 Re: Training Workshops Available https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;ccf6bdb2.1411 Dear Angie,<br><br>The details weren't clear, could you resend?<br><br>Hubert<br><br>Prof Hubert Lacey<br>Emeritus Professor, St George's, Uni of London<br>Medical Director, Newbridge Healthcare<br>Lead Consultant in Eating Disorders,<br>Capio Nightingale Hospital, London<br><br>> On 26 Nov 2014, at 15:05, "Jakubowska Angie (AVON AND WILTSHIRE MENTAL HEALTH PARTNERSHIP NHS TRUST)" <angie.jakubowska@NHS.NET> wrote:<br>><br>> Dear All<br>><br>> Please find attached fliers for 2 training workshops we have coming up. If you are interested details on how to book are contained within the flier.<br>><br>> Regards<br>> Angie<br>><br>> Angie Jakubowska<br>> Clinical Specialist in Eating Disorders<br>> [...] Jakubowska Angie (AVON AND WILTSHIRE MENTAL HEALTH PARTNERSHIP NHS TRUST) 2014-11-26T15:05:11+00:00 2014-11-26T15:05:11+00:00 Training Workshops Available https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;437181a6.1411 Dear All<br><br>Please find attached fliers for 2 training workshops we have coming up. If you are interested details on how to book are contained within the flier.<br><br>Regards<br>Angie<br><br>Angie Jakubowska<br>Clinical Specialist in Eating Disorders<br>Please note my email had changed to angie.jakubowska@nhs.net<mailto:angie.jakubowska@nhs.net><br>Avon and Wiltshire Mental Health Partnership NHS Trust<br>STEPs Unit<br>Eating Disorder Service<br>Clifton Building<br>Southmead Hospital<br>Westbury on Trym<br>Bristol BS10 5NB<br>T: 0117 323 6113 F: 0117 323 6173<br>www.awp.nhs.uk<http://www.awp.nhs.uk/> Rebecca Park 2014-11-20T23:53:01+00:00 2014-11-20T23:53:01+00:00 Re: offspring of maternal ED/ DBS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;abc2fbab.1411 Thanks Frances very well put . Attached an old paper of mine reviewing the research on offspring of mat ED. The bigger picture on a case by case basis is however so crucial clinically, and an awareness of the needs of the child both pre and postnatally.<br>Fortunately the very good specialist obstetric service in Oxford have accepted an urgent referral \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. [...] Ayton Agnes (RNU) Oxford Health 2014-11-20T23:15:24+00:00 2014-11-20T23:15:24+00:00 I'm sharing "Associations of maternal weight gain in pregnancy with offspring cognition in childhood and adolescence: findings from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children." https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;7e5fafe1.1411 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;7e5fafe1.1411">I'm sharing "Associations of maternal weight gain in pregnancy with offspring cognition in childhood and adolescence: findings from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children." </a> Connan Frances (CENTRAL AND NORTH WEST LONDON NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-11-20T22:05:47+00:00 2014-11-20T22:05:47+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;8f7dcbd8.1411 I think that's exactly the concern that means it's essential to think long term and bigger picture - and hope to sustain engagement well beyond delivery. We have found that's v difficult with mums and their babies in these circs. The better the experience the mum has with us during the pregnancy, the better the chances. Things can quickly feel adversarial, frightening & intimidating for the mum.<br>Best wishes [...] Roger Walters 2014-11-20T20:57:50+00:00 2014-11-20T20:57:50+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;103aced2.1411 I wonder what they long term outcome is for babies of mums with this degree of chronicity, can they provide what the child needs long term emotionally esp<br><br>roger<br><br>> On 20 Nov 2014, at 18:30, Connan Frances (CENTRAL AND NORTH WEST LONDON NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) <frances.connan@NHS.NET> wrote:<br>><br>> Hi All<br>><br>> Apologies - i responded first in a rush this morning and didn't send round all.<br>> Safeguarding is certainly important, but needs to be done very carefully and sensitively.<br>><br>> This was my email:<br>><br>> I have seen several cases like this. I suggest [...] Connan Frances (CENTRAL AND NORTH WEST LONDON NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-11-20T18:30:34+00:00 2014-11-20T18:30:34+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;5465ee0d.1411 Hi All<br><br>Apologies - i responded first in a rush this morning and didn't send round all.<br>Safeguarding is certainly important, but needs to be done very carefully and sensitively.<br><br>This was my email:<br><br>I have seen several cases like this. I suggest work closely with obstetrician and midwives. And partner if there is one. Foetal growth monitoring can be a useful guide alongside weight. Standard is for women to gain 10-12kg during pregnancy. She almost certainly won't manage that. The foetus will be parasitic, and will do better than you think. I would suggest MHA if she lacks capacity [...] Whittaker Jane F (CAMHS) (RW3) CMFT Manchester 2014-11-20T12:11:08+00:00 2014-11-20T12:11:08+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;d30a5949.1411 Is there any data on outcomes for the health outcomes of the baby (growth, health, brain etc)? I know there I a lot available about mental health outcomes for children and the famine literature has info about cognitive development?<br><br>Sent from my Windows Phone Adrienne Key 2014-11-20T11:59:49+00:00 2014-11-20T11:59:49+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;f0a589a8.1411 I had a lady who conceived at bmi 12 on 3 occasions, the baby died the first time and when she conceived again she was referred to services. I saw her weekly in outpatients as she refused admission on both occasions. She gained the minimum weight required of 10.5kg and on both pregnancies the baby was born at 34 weeks but ok. She remained at low bmi but functioned<br>Adrienne [...] Ayton Agnes (RNU) Oxford Health 2014-11-20T09:52:42+00:00 2014-11-20T09:52:42+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;8368b8f7.1411 We have already explored safeguarding - they want to wait until the baby is born, but they have a FSW<br><br>With best wishes<br>Dr Agnes Ayton<br>MD MMedSc FRCPsych MSc<br>Consultant Psychiatrist<br>Cotswold House Oxford<br>Warneford Hospital<br>Old Rd<x-apple-data-detectors://1><br>Oxford<x-apple-data-detectors://1><br>OX3 7JX<x-apple-data-detectors://1><br><br>07585402210<tel:07585402210><br>01865738835<tel:01865738835><br><br>On 20 Nov 2014, at 09:36, "Nicholls, Dasha" <d.nicholls@UCL.AC.UK<mailto:d.nicholls@UCL.AC.UK>> wrote:<br><br>I would hope not but found myself wondering about the threshold. [...] Nicholls, Dasha 2014-11-20T09:33:28+00:00 2014-11-20T09:33:28+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;9858d00f.1411 I would hope not but found myself wondering about the threshold.<br><br>Dasha<br><br>Dr Dasha Nicholls MBBS MRCPsych MD(Res) FAED<br>Consultant Child and Adolescent Psychiatrist<br>Feeding and Eating Disorders Service<br>Department of Child and Adolescent Mental Health<br>Great Ormond Street Hospital<br>London WC1N 3JH<br>+ 44 (0)20 7829 8679<br>+44 (0)20 7813 8411<br>Academic email: d.nicholls@ucl.ac.uk<mailto:d.nicholls@ich.ucl.ac.uk><br>Clinical email: dasha.nicholls@gosh.nhs.uk<mailto:dasha.nicholls@gosh.nhs.uk><br><br>From: The Eating Disorders Special Interest Group [mailto:EDSIG@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of McQueen Daniel (CYGNET HEALTH CARE LIMITED)<br>Sent: 20 November 2014 09:32<br>To: EDSIG@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 [...] McQueen Daniel (CYGNET HEALTH CARE LIMITED) 2014-11-20T09:32:02+00:00 2014-11-20T09:32:02+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;96496634.1411 Is there any question as to whether a safeguarding referral will take place?<br>Dan McQueen<br><br>On 20 Nov 2014, at 08:56, Nicholls, Dasha <d.nicholls@UCL.AC.UK<mailto:d.nicholls@UCL.AC.UK>> wrote:<br><br>Hi all<br><br>Very interesting. Frances, I am curious about what the child safeguarding approach was in your cases. If the maternal problems were addiction the new born children would be subject to safeguarding procedures. [...] Nicholls, Dasha 2014-11-20T08:56:16+00:00 2014-11-20T08:56:16+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;e2414c61.1411 Hi all<br><br>Very interesting. Frances, I am curious about what the child safeguarding approach was in your cases. If the maternal problems were addiction the new born children would be subject to safeguarding procedures.<br><br>Dasha<br><br>Dr Dasha Nicholls MBBS MRCPsych MD(Res) FAED<br>Consultant Child and Adolescent Psychiatrist<br>Feeding and Eating Disorders Service<br>Department of Child and Adolescent Mental Health<br>Great Ormond Street Hospital<br>London WC1N 3JH<br>+ 44 (0)20 7829 8679<br>+44 (0)20 7813 8411<br>Academic email: d.nicholls@ucl.ac.uk<mailto:d.nicholls@ich.ucl.ac.uk><br>Clinical email: dasha.nicholls@gosh.nhs.uk<mailto:dasha.nicholls@gosh.nhs.uk> [...] Connan Frances (CENTRAL AND NORTH WEST LONDON NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-11-20T08:50:32+00:00 2014-11-20T08:50:32+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;d8fb11aa.1411 Agreed. But some don't eat during pregnancy. I've had 2 cases deliver at bmi 13-14. Sent more detailed reply direct to Agnes. Both denied having assisted conception. They were v low weight, and then lost weight after getting pregnant.<br><br>Dr Frances Connan<br>Consultant Psychiatrist & Clinical Director<br>Vincent Square Eating Disorders Service<br><br>Sent from my iPhone [...] Mark Tattersall 2014-11-20T08:31:11+00:00 2014-11-20T08:31:11+00:00 Re: Pregnancy with a BMI of 13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EDSIG;88d271fc.1411 Hi Agnes,<br><br>Received wisdom is that eating disordered patients eat better while they are pregnant (as they feel they are eating for the baby, which helps their sense of guilt). I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve had incompletely recovered patients who had healthy babies (e.g. still a little underweight, but bulimic) whose ability to contain their disordered eating did indeed improve during pregnancy (but usually relapsed for a while after the birth), but have never had a patient who was pregnant with a BMI that low - surprising that she was able to conceive, or did she have medical assistance?
